intro: [WRONG START] Asperula hirsuta var. squarrosa, commonly known as the hairy woodbine, is a deciduous shrub native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features small, fragrant white flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has slender, woody stems that are often covered in fine, hairy hairs. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly serrated edge. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and stream banks.
